Reviews.Title: “Okay for short business trips”
Reviews.Author: RobHutchings
Reviews.Content: The service is okay for this type of hotel and the rooms are okay but there is always a funny smell in the hallways to the rooms, internet access is limited and depending on where you book the room is a little miss leading!

Reviews.Title: “Great VFM and unbeatable location - for Cold War and WW2 buffs”
Reviews.Author: kvr4060
Reviews.Content: I am a WW2 and Cold War Buff and from that point of view, the location of this hotel is simply unbeatable. Anhalter Bahnof ruins - 50 m. Prinz Albrechtsrasse Gestapo HQ - now a museum Topography of terror - about 200 m, with a section of The Wall adjacent to the museum. Hermann Goering's Reich Air Ministry - now the German Finance Ministry - bang opposite the Topography of Terror. Hitler's Fuhrer Bunker location - now a car park - about 300 - 400 m. The Holocaust Memorial and museum - about 100 m from the car park. Brandbenburg Tor and Hotel Adlon - another 100 m. Soviet War Memorial - about 200 m from Brandenburg Tor. Reichstag. Siegesaul - another 3 - 400 m from Tor. You can lazily walk it up and finish all of these in half a day - as I did (though I would have loved to spend more time in the Holocaust and Topography of Terror museums) . Don't forget Checkpoint Charlie which is about half to 1 km from this hotel. If you are not the Cold War or WW2 buff tyoes - and its hard to escape both these 20th Century events in Berlin - then go to Potsdamer Platz which is about 200 m from the hotel, buy a Hop on Hop off ticket - as I did - and you can tour Berlin and see the other historical sites. As an Indian , I found the "all you can eat for 10 Euro " breakfast , absolutely monotonous (same spread for 3 days ) and even pathetic but I am sure most Westerners will like the breakfast . Its no frills stay and no room service but that's why the hotel is so cheap (about 130 Euro for 2 nights three days for a couple ! ) It was comfortablebut again the room is no frills - you want tea or coffee or anything to east , you have to go down to the restaurant on the ground floor. The Net connection in the room was chargeable but is free in the lobby ! All in all for a history buff like me, the location is unbeatable

Reviews.Title: “nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: brovadsafaris1
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 7 nights in march. The location of the hotel is perfect! Just next to the postdamer platz, and a very short walk into town or into the zoo. The hotel itself is quite comfortable, and the hotel staff were very helpful to recommend activities and set up reservations. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Central location, average value for money and service perfectible”
Reviews.Author: elie_flatter
Reviews.Content: * usual breakfast; * clean room with some elements slightly damaged (curtains with holes); * a lot of satellite TV programms in various languages; * impersonal and improvable service - anecdotally, on my arrival, I checked-in and pre-paid the 139 EUR overnight accomodation cost. After having dropped my luggage in the room, I went to the bar to have a coffee. I paid for my espresso on the spot, sat down and 15 minutes after I drunk a cafe, while I was leaving the bar area, I was chased and challenged, for a couple of minutes, by a waiter requesting me to re-pay for the cafe and requiring me to provide a physical description of her colleague who received my cash paiement. This gave me a feeling of mistrust which is not very customer friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & great value for the price !”
Reviews.Author: GreatDaneDanmark
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights ,the hotel has a very good location on a quiet street , the room was clean and had a nice bed.The bathroom was small but it was spotless clean . No free shampoo ;) Good breakfast & friendly people at the reception. There was free wireless in the the reception area as well as a couple of computers you could use. I enjoyed my stay , but have to say that the 9 euros i paid every day to have wireless in my room was a total rip-off , as it was difficult to establish a connection on my Iphone , and the speed was so slow that it would make a turtle look like a speedy gonzalez !!! A nice touch they had , was a safe room where you could leave your stuff, after you checked out , and then collect it later . I would not have any problem to come back in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good hospitality in Ibis Berlin Postdamer Platz”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: After a few days travel from Paris, Amsterdam then Berlin, I get service hospitable, good attentive and highly assist in Ibis Berlin Postdamer Platz compared with previous hotels. Ibis Berlin Postdamer Platz.....low price good hospitality

Reviews.Title: “excellent, only, as in all Ibis Hotels, towels are to small”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel, in a good location,walking distance to Potzdammer Platz and Brandenburger Tor, Nice restaurant with good food and a very nice french wine ,only as in all Ibis Hotels, towels are very small.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas break”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with very helpful staff. Ideally located for visiting the sights and some socializing. Potsdamer Platz is a very short walk from the hotel for all shopping and social needs. Transport system is easily accessible and very reasonably priced. It cost 3 euro to travel from the airport to the hotel bu train, some 45 minute trip.

Reviews.Title: “Ibis Berlin Potsdamer Platz, Nov.2011”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit and I will definitely stay again. Friendly, professional guy on reception, nice quiet room at rear, very clean, good breakfast and great location for S-Bahn. The heating wasn't very effective and it was very cold weather but I don't blame this hotel as I have noticed this recently in all Accor hotels I have stayed in (Ibis, Novotel and Mercure). I suspect there is a company policy to cut down on heating in all hotels to save money.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly good hotel in a wonderfull location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Generally I liked my stay. It absolutely meet my needs, which where a good and central place to stay in Berlin. The staff at the front desk where very helpfull and the facility is fair for its price. What I would further like to have in hotel room is a refrigerator (mini bar) where I can put some staff which I buy outside and to have something to drink in the evening. Additional to this I would like to have also a small couch for wathing TV. Out of that I enjoyed my stay very much

Reviews.Title: “visiting expos”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: it was generally good. the beds not so comfortable. We found the finishings a bit close to a lower range of Accor hotels finishings. We found a too low number of foreign TV channels accessible in the room. The internet access in the lobby was not extremely performing.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended for tourist trip to Berlin”
Reviews.Author: CMC-24
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed four nights at this Hotel whilst on a short break in Berlin. We found the hotel to be very well located for our needs (although it is not at Potsdammer Platz). It was easy to travel from Shonefeld Airport to Friedrichstrasse Banholf (Station) and then change and get a train to Anhalter Banholf which is only a couple of hundred yards from the hotel if you come out of the correct exit. The cost from the airport to the hotel was 3 Euros each (using an ABC ticket that can be obtained from a desk in the airport of from ticket machines). However, please note that most machines only take coins or Maestro Cards – not Mastercard or Visa. The hotel was clean, our room was very comfortable and the staff were very friendly with excellent English. We did not eat in the hotel so cannot really comment on the restaurant although I am sure it would be fine. There are several restaurants fairly close by. I liked the Italian restaurant at the end of the street – only a couple of hundred yards from the hotel. I was able to use WiFi for free in the lobby. There was a charge for using the service in our room. My only criticism of the hotel was that it didn’t have tea and coffee making facilities in the room. I would recommend this hotel if you are looking for reasonably priced accommodation for a visit to Berlin. I would certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Located at the city center - near the Potsdamer Platz and the Brandenburg Gate U-bahn and S-bahn stations just at the corner Unter der Linden blvd is 15 min walking from the hotel. Available underground parking. Rooms are the new IBIS design with the rounded bathroom and large spaces around the bed(s). Unfortunately it will be better if you speak German at the reception. The staff speaks English but a lot of confusions may occur.

Reviews.Title: “Berlin Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable and good price. VERY close to the Anhalter StrVery comfortable and good price. VERY close to the Anhalter Strasse Bahnhof Station.asse Bahnhof Station. Very comfortable and good price. VERY close to the Anhalter Strasse Bahnhof Station.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied visitor”
Reviews.Author: jimmarj Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Second time we have stayed at this hotel and can not fault it. The staff were extrtemely helpful - the rooms were comfortable - the food was good and the location is very central for all forms of public transport which we made good use of with our Welcome Cards.

Reviews.Title: “Straight up chain hotel, but the wifi sucks”
Reviews.Author: HolyDuck
Reviews.Content: It's not a bad hotel. It's a modern chain thingy, so you kinda know what you're gonna get. And the basics were sorta okay. But still I had a few annoyances. The desk in the room is wide enough, but there is almost no room for the legs under the table, which makes it kinda awkward to work. The chair is also rather uncomfortable, so the bed became the default office space. There were just two power outlets in my room (one used by tv), so charging anything was a bit of a hassle. But worst of all, the paid wi-fi is absolutely crap. It isn't the most expensive I've used in a hotel (3 Euro/hour, 6 Euro/5hrs isn't too shabby), but I'd rather pay a bit more and actually have decent connection speeds. There is free access in the lobby, but when I tried working there the speeds weren't much better and I kept getting kicked off and then had to enter name etc again. If you advertise your wifi, make it work, people! Tried the breakfast buffet (10 Euro) on the last day, and it wasn't too bad, actually. Plenty of healthy-ish options, including salmon and fresh fruit.

Reviews.Title: “location location location”
Reviews.Author: docrkd
Reviews.Content: what you see is what you get with ibis, large group of us in berlin to play rugby, perfect group tour hotel, clean, good breakfast and we walked everywhere. they also put up with our tour antics... will go back there again

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and clean but not as central as you might think”
Reviews.Author: elen_9
Reviews.Content: We were expecting a more central position. The personnel is very friendly but would need some more professional experience. One thing we did not appreciate was the fact that the receptionist was answering the phone during our check-in. We got interrupted several times. We were charged 10€ per person for breakfast. We took the option because it was difficult to get the children out (very cold days) early in the morning looking for breakfast but this was a rather high price for Berlin standards. Be aware when you look at cheep room rates. Breakfast might very well end up to cost as much as a room! We ate once at the restaurant (too tired to leave the hotel). The quality was very good, the service very friently but not of great variety.

Reviews.Title: “Ibis / Etap at Potsdamer Platz Berlin is NOT near Potsdamer Platz !!!”
Reviews.Author: Chris2006
Reviews.Content: Ibis Berlin Potsdamer Platz is not near Potsdamer Platz at all. I arrived tired at Potsdamer Platz S/U-Bahn after an exhausting diversion to Berlin via Hamburg on the ICE train due to Berlin Tegel being closed by snow. On the surface in the middle of the Platz and Xmas Market I looked all around yet couldn't see the familiar Ibis / Etap signs. Not surprising - these hotels are no-where neat the Potsdamer Platz. EVENTUALLY I HAD TO GET A TAXI WHICH COST ME 6 EUROS TO GET THERE - THEY WERE BOTH TUCKED DOWN A SIDE STREET OVER 15 MINUTES WALKING / 7 MINUTES BY CAB AWAY. It is blatently dishonest of Accor to deliberately mislead tourists about the location of these hotels incl. the Novotel next door. Asit happened the nearest U-Bahn stop was Anhalter Bahnhof - wish I'd known that 'cos I has a tourist day pass. Oh and the 'free' wifi at the hotel was so slow as to be unusable.

Reviews.Title: “A cheap hotel, both in a positive and negative sense”
Reviews.Author: Bumble-Burt
Reviews.Content: First, the good news -- This hotel is clean It offers basic comforts ... working shower, simple breakfast, comfortable bed It is within a block and a half of a fairly busy S-bahn station The staff are reasonably polite It is fairly inexpensive. Next, the bad news: This hotel is cheap in the mean sense -- It offers WiFi, but that sevice costs 4 Euros ($5.25) / day and is inconvenient (users must freshly login for every single use, the username and password change every day, and the interface is not very transparent) Residents cannot easily use the room phone to make outside calls (on my first attempt, I was asked to go to front desk to make a 10 Euro ($13.50), partly-refundable deposit! I was asked to pay for the full expected cost of my 4-night stay upon checking in, a serious inconvenience if you must or wish to check out earlier than expected. Like other German hotels, this one is under the impression that hand soap, bath soap, and hair shampoo are all identical and can be dispensed from the same liquid dispenser. Unlike other German hotels, this one LOCKS separate soap containers to the sink and to the shower. My shower soap dispenser was empty before the end of my stay, but the only way to use the soap dispenser at the sink was to step, dripping, out of the shower. Not pleasant. Amazingly cheap and poor tv set. Guys, a good one would only cost 30 Euros more! The front desk staff were not well trained. Checking in, paying, and purchasing WiFi access took an inordinate amount of time. On balance: Not a pleasant hotel if you're staying in one of Europe's greatest cities.

Reviews.Title: “I don,t know what you mean with the headline”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We are using the Etap hotels in general, why we know the facilities wery well. We are especial pleased with the booking systens via the internet. We have never had a missing booking , why we in the future want to continue to use the Etap hotel. The actuel hotel in Berlin has been chosen becaurce of the placing.We used it last year and pla to use again nex year.

Reviews.Title: “Short stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Ibis Berlin Potsdamer Platz has an excellent location , within walking distance to Check Point Charlie , Friedrichstrasse , Brandenburg Gate . Anhalter Subway Station is 100 yards at end of street . Hotel is clean warm and serves a good breakfast and evening meal .

Reviews.Title: “Friendliness”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was exellent og the staff were eager to please and make our stay in Berlin perfect. Thank you for everything. Kind regards Jacob

Reviews.Title: “Location, value and service very good”
Reviews.Author: pharm51
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 8 nights at this hotel. Service was very good and staff willing to help (except for one receptionist who hardly smiled). Rooms were clean. Breakfast was buffet with a very good selection of hot and cold items. One night we also had dinner in the hotel and the food was good, abundant and reasonably priced. There are a couple of restaurants nearby. The location is also very good as there is an S-Bahn (Anhalter) further down the road and two buses, M41 and M29 which we found very convenient - used them more than the S-Bahn. M29 passes by the hotel. It is about 10 minutes walk from Potsdamer Platz or one stopby bus/S-Bahn. The only drawback we had was that our room was overlooking the street which is very busy so we had to keep the window closed at night and the AC was not so good. There were 2 PC terminals and a printer in the lobby which one can use free of charge.

Reviews.Title: “perfect choice”
Reviews.Author: claychalk
Reviews.Content: Good value for money hotel. Central location close to Checkpoint Charlie. Friendly, very helpful staff and very clean. Rooms comfortable.Breakfasts reasonably priced and wide choice.Would choose to stay at Ibis hotels in future and have already recommended to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good value Clean Room Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Passenger30
Reviews.Content: I personally recommend this Ibis for the reasons mentioned in the title.. Of course its not in postdamer platz but that didnt irritate me at all.. only one station away and 10min walking.. The view from the 6th floor is splendid.. As for the staff as in every hotel you will find good bad and willing people.. p.s when you go to a city abroad you dont have the requirements from the hotel members to know everything.. i personally dont.. i have done my research and i know what do..at least in most of my activities! god bless tripadvisor! :)

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: gayinoakpark
Reviews.Content: We're retired and have therefore become budget travelers. We had four destinations in Germany and our goal was to find in each one an acceptable hotel for under $100 per night. This is not an easy task, especially in expensive cities like Berlin! The IBIS Potsdamer Platz was a great option. IBIS is one of the hotel chains now owned by Accor Hotels. On the IBIS website we booked a double room for 49 Euros per night! (Full disclosure: this rate was restricted to payment in advance and was non-refundable, but we had trip insurance so it was worth taking the risk). The rate did not include breakfast but we paid the 10 Euros each to eat breakfast there -- a great buffet. We both need at least three cups of coffee to get going in the morning, and when you consider that a single cup of coffee on the street is 2 Euros or more, the buffet with all the coffee you can drink is a relative bargain! So with breakfasts our daily rate was 69 Euros per night which is still a fantastic price for two people. Many of the hostel/hotels in Berlin were considerably more expensive than that for two people in a private room. This appears to be one of the newer IBIS hotels -- both the room and the bathroom (en suite) were very spacious with adequate closet and storage space. Our room was on the 7th floor on the street side. The street is very quiet and we often had the window open overnight without experiencing street noise. The front desk staff were universally friendly and helpful. There are two computers in the lobby offering free internet access. From the window we could see Potsdamer Platz and the Bundestag dome. The "Topography of Terror" museum is a block away. The hotel is about a 15 minute leisurely walk to Potsdamer platz. There is a subway line 1/2 block from the hotel. Bus No. 41, also 1/2 block away, connects the hotel to the main train station (only about 15 minutes in normal traffic or about 10 minutes in light traffic), Bus No. 29, also 1/2 block away, takes you to Nollendorf Platz where KDW is located (Europe's largest department store with a food section not-to-be-missed!). For you late-nighters, several night buses will take you to Potsdamer Platz.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect locatkion”
Reviews.Author: LyndaB1
Reviews.Content: to see Berlin from all angles - historical, cultural, recent and long past

Reviews.Title: “great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: golfidian
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights and wasn't disappointed. Before I booked I searched through loads of hotels on tripadvisor and all top rated ones where too pricey or had "strange" things like the possibility of single beds in the room etc. Too cut a long story short, I got tired of searching and comparing and booked the Ibis for the great special rate of only 49Euros a night. The location itself is not special or touristy but you are quite close to many sights. There are plenty of places to eat in not too far distance and the S-Bahn stop directly opposite. The service we experienced was incredibly friendly and helpful...although we arrived very early in the morning we could leave the luggage and get a room much earlier than the official check-in time. Another plus is the free internet on the two computers in the lobby. The room is basic and not very stylish but who would expect that for this price!? We didn't have breakfast there but there is a Cafe in the same road where you can eat for less until 4 in the afternoon. So all in all a very pleasant stay and we will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Good central location, very fair price”
Reviews.Author: fcsklabrie
Reviews.Content: If you're familiar with the Ibis concept, this will not be a surprise to you. This is a very good central location for Berlin. 2 min walk to Anhalter S-Bahn station, 15 min walk to Potsdamer Platz, 10 min walk to Checkpoint Charlie. Restaurants and groceries around. Fair size room, good price (you can get a very good deal when booking 21 days in advance non-redundable), good showers. Only cons are no free wifi in rooms (2 computers downstairs, often busy), and no safe.

Reviews.Title: “There are better offers in this price range...”
Reviews.Author: bah69
Reviews.Content: Did not have high expectations when checking in to this hotel, but despite that I left disappointed. The receptionist was very unfriendly and did not make you feel welcome. The room was clean and reasonably large but the bed was not very comfortable. The bathroom was clean but quite small and "plastic". The hotel boasts about all rooms being air conditioned, and they all are. what they don't tell you is that they only turn it on when the temperature outside climbs over 25 Celsius. We stayed at the hotel in July, and I can tell that when it's 23 degrees outside the room gets warm. The reception told me the reason for having the air conditioner turned of was environmental. This is very noble, but if I am to pay for an air conditioned room I think it would be up to me how much of an environmentalist I like to be. The recommendation I got was to open a window, the room we had was facing the street and having the window open made the room very noisy from all the traffic outside. The Location, however, is good, close to many of the more popular sites.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for sight seeing”
Reviews.Author: Cape8101
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel at the train station. The location was great to see the sights since we walked to all the locations. The hotel was very clean and we had excellent service. The only problem occurred when we booked the room it was supposed to have air conditioning. However, when we got into the room I called the front desk to let them know that the A/C wasn't working. The receptionist told us that the A/C isn't turned on until the outside tempature was above 80 degree farenhiet. The receptionist came up and opened our window, but it was still warm.

Reviews.Title: “Good location outside, classic Ibis inside!”
Reviews.Author: MikePadgett
Reviews.Content: If you're the sort of person that can tolerate that unique laundry-plastic smell of an Ibis hotel, which I can and which is the same in most countries, then you'll know what you're getting here. Location was excellent: U-Bahn station just outside and over the street with Potsdamer Platz about 10 minutes walk and the Gemaldegalerie about 20 minutes. Good breakfast, excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Can't get better”
Reviews.Author: SusieQBury_7
Reviews.Content: Returned yesterday from Berlin. This hotel like many Ibis Hotels already stayed in was very good indeed. This was one of the most spacious Ibis hotels. The room was larger and more modern. Breakfast was typical Ibis with hot boiled eggs and omelette. Probably more choice actually with fruit yoghurts, fresh fruits, various rolls and breads, cheese, ham, dips etc. Anhalter Bahnhof practically on the doorstep with one stop to Potsdamer Platz and 3 to Friedrichstrasse Bahnhof which is the gateway to many underground lines. We got a Berlin Welcome Card which was fantastic - travel on all transport plus discount on tours, museums etc. If you wanted a change from Ibis breakfast then Cafe Streseman just on the corner of the street. Varied choice - eggs and ham, toast and butter and omelette very good. Bit cheaper than Ibis but of course at Ibis you can choose and eat as much as you want. Also have as many top-ups on fruit juice, tea, coffee etc. Also at Ibis is a garden at the back where meals can be taken. Internet access is via two computers in reception this is free. If you take your own laptop then wifi is only available in reception and on 6th floor. This is chargeable. If coming to Berlin again would defnitely stay at this hotel. Lovely Italian restaurant on opposite corner to Cafe Streseman where we ate 2 meals.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but some problem”
Reviews.Author: fi100
Reviews.Content: Although I must admit that the price and the location is good, I found an unfriendly receptionist, and a horrible bed. It was dirty with many hair.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Excellent Price.”
Reviews.Author: Ballard98107
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on Jan 3rd 2008 for 3 days, 2 nights. After a flight from Rome to Tegel it was quite easy getting to the hotel, since transportation in Berlin is excellent. We took the X9 109 Bus from Tegel to Zoologischer Garden station. From there Get on the U2 to Potsdamer Platz, transfer to the S2 to Anhalter Bahnhof and you are then right around the corner. We road the S2 quite often as we really like the Berlin Insider Tours which meet outside of Zoologischer Garden in front of the Dunkin Donuts across from the station. I would recommend getting a tour with Nigel as he is the most entertaining and knowledgeable of the lot. The hotel room was super clean and exactly what we expected. When we registered we opted out of the breakfast, as there are many places to eat at the stations or at our destinations. The service is great too, when we needed extra towels they seemed to arrive rather quickly. This particular hotel has many international travelers, but with the amount of traffic in and out it was extremely quiet. Our particular room had a bizarre shower/restroom with a revolving type door. This eccentricity was interesting. It worked well and no problems with water temp etc. Overall the value was great and you really couldn't beat the price. Just watch out for the bike paths!

Reviews.Title: “Ibis never lets us down, not this time either.”
Reviews.Author: ThroughEurope
Reviews.Content: As usual, the Ibis hotels are nice, clean and reasonable. This hotel has a good location, with nice restaurants in the area, try breakfast at Cafè Stresseman at the corner. It is also easy to travel with the U- bahn from Anhalter Bahnhof, wich is right next to the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value And Well Located”
Reviews.Author: Spainrich
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights. Room exactly the same design as an IBIS hotel we stayed at in April 08. Comfortable enough for our needs, though could have been hoovered more often. Spacious plastic shower booth prone to flooding rest of bathroom. Staff polite and efficient , especially in restaurant at night. You must try the currywurst. Breakfast plentiful for a full day spent walking around Berlin. 2 workstations in the lobby with free Internet access. Near S- and U-Bahn stations. Topology of Terror and Checkpoint Charlie close by. Would recommend. Full of German nationals which to me is a good sign.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a city break”
Reviews.Author: f2010
Reviews.Content: This is an excellently located hotel for a city break, just 5 minutes walk from Checkpoint Charlie, and many other points of interest. It was less than 5 minutes walk to the rail station, and about 10 minutes to the nearest underground station. The hotel was comfortable, with pleasant rooms (the only disadvantage was that the shower door design meant that the bathroom floor got flooded !). Breakfast was a good buffet. We ate in the hotel restaurant one night, and had a pleasant, good value meal. There was free internet access in the lobby. The reception staff were helpful. Overall, this was a ideal hotel for an enjoyable and interesting city break.

Reviews.Title: “Met expectations”
Reviews.Author: darrenmcc
Reviews.Content: Having previously stayed in the Ibis Zaragoza which had HUGE rooms, I was slightly disappointed by the size of the room in this hotel; but then again I wasn't in Berlin to spend my days in a hotel room. The room was basic Ibis - comfy, clean, with a great shower. Needed extra pillows though and the reception only had one, about which they were very apologetic. Didn't have breakfast so cannot comment, but I did eat dinner in the hotel and it was tasty and filling. The only negative was the reception assistant at check-in (Heike): she was quite abrupt almost to the point of rudeness and I was not particularly taken by that attitude. All the other staff, however, were very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent budget hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: QQ61
Reviews.Content: Clean, modern, comfortable hotel for a very reasonable price. Rooms are fine for one person but a couple might find it a little cramped, especially if you have a lot of luggage. The bathroom is a kind of prefabricated, plastic cubicle but the shower is surprisingly spacious. No toiletries provided apart from soap. The T.V. has no English channels (I don't think it even had CNN, though I'm not absolutely sure), but you must have better things to do than watch T.V. The receptionists and bar staff speak English, as you'd expect. The road where it is located, Anhalter Strasse, is not very busy, so even though I had a room right at the front I was not troubled by noise at night. There is a small restaurant. The buffet breakfast has a good selection of bread, cold meats, cheese, and fruit, with juice and coffee from a machine, but there's no hot food apart from boiled eggs. You have to pay in advance. When you check in, the receptionist will ask you if you want breakfast . If you say yes, she will assume you mean every day and charge you accordingly. I don't know if you can choose to have it some days but not others. So if you like to pig out on cooked breakfasts, it's probably better to say no and go to the excellent Cafe Stresemann opposite. I didn't eat dinner at the hotel, but the menu looked quite good and I overheard another guest saying his steak was the best he'd ever had. Location is excellent provided you are reasonably healthy. Potsdamer Platz is about 5 minutes walk and Friedrichstrasse/Checkpoint Charlie about 10 minutes walk. The Anhalter Bahnhof S-Bahn station is about 2 minutes walk and there is a taxi rank by the side of it (in front of the Movenpick Hotel). Lots of places to eat nearby - I like the Cafe Stresemann but there is also an Italian restaurant that has been favourably reviewed elsewhere. There is a small convenience store a few doors up and a supermarket round the corner. In the lobby there are two PCs with free Internet access. One of them has a French keyboard, which threw me for a while until I realised what it was. But can't complain - Ibis is a French company. If you are looking for a budget hotel, especially if you are travelling alone, I definitely recommend the Ibis.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean, friendly efficient staff”
Reviews.Author: AFCW
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a short (4/5 day) city break to Berlin. The hotel maintains all the usual IBIS high standards - room spotlessly clean, but nothing too fancy. Breakfast is the usual continental style, but well worth having, and the restaurant was never too crowded. The restaurant also doubles up as the bar in the evening, we found this surprisingly atmospheric for a 3 star hotel bar, so well worth popping in for one last drink at the end of the evening! As for location, there isnt loads around the hotel, apart from a bar/cafe across the road on the corner, which was fine, and there is also an Italian restaurant nearby, which we did not try. There is an Aldi supermarket just round the corner too. Aanhalter Bahnhoff (station) is 1 minute walk from the hotel, from here, a train will take you to the centre in just 5 or 10 minutes. I do recommend the tourist pass 3 day train ticket for just under 20 Euros. Alternatively, it is only a 10-15 minute walk to Potsdamer Platz, some nice cafes/bars/restaurants there. To summarise, this is a perfect hotel for a short stay in Berlin, I cannot fault it.

HotelInfo.Name: Ibis Berlin Potsdamer Platz
HotelInfo.Address: Anhalter Strasse 4, 10963 Berlin, Germany
